POSITION SUMMARY
The Senior Data Analyst will drive transforming data across multiple systems into actionable business insights. The incumbent will be responsible for the full lifecycle of analysis including requirements, data acquisition, design, data quality, analysis and reporting. The incumbent will collaborate with multiple teams to develop dashboards, visualizations, metrics, performance indicators and data quality audits; using the data to tell a meaningful story and determine the key to success. The incumbent will foster an analytics culture within Atlanta Public Schools through advocating data-based insights, bolstering data quality oversight and sharing best practices.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources
Develops and implements databases/data collection systems that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Identifies data quality issues, reports findings to data owners and facilitates the development of action plans
Interprets data and analyzes results using statistical techniques
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets
Develops dashboards and/or reports to meet the business reporting need to tell a meaningful story
Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
Defines, designs and manages master data within the reporting systems, including creation, updates, users, user roles
Designs and manages the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata
Troubleshoots the reporting database environment reporting to supervisor when issues arise
Provides technical expertise on data management
Performs other duties as assigned by appropriate administrator
Required to attend scheduled shift during regular business hours as mandated

Requirements
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's degree in business administration, management information systems, information technology, computer science, data science, or a related field required
Master's degree in business administration, management information systems, information technology, computer science, data science, or a related field preferred
CERTIFICATION/LICENSE:
Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) preferred
Microsoft Technology Associate Certification with a specialization in SQL Databases preferred
WORK EXPERIENCE:
5 years of work experience with data analytics, modeling and report development
Demonstrated experience in statistics, statistical modeling and statistical tools (Minitab preferred)
Demonstrated experience in report development and visualization development
Demonstrated experience with handling large data sets, database design and database development
Experience with developing, implementing and/or maintaining data collection systems from multiple sources
Experience in project management of cross functional teams
Experience with common business intelligence and visualization tools (PowerBi and Cognos experience preferred)
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Proficient in at least one programming language (i.e. R, VBA, Python, SQL, ETL, Javascript)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Demonstrated aptitude for learning new technologies
Ability to work under pressure, adjust and set priorities to meet deadlines
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivated, proactive, action-oriented, results-driven
Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast moving environment that supports students and schools
Strong team player with proven ability to collaborate across teams
Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and senior management

Salary Grade: 133

Description
Oversee Enterprise Data Lake development and operations to acquire, ingest and manage data from variety of Enterprise data sources. This will include partnering with data management capabilities including data ingestion, storage, metadata, data quality and data lineage for an extensible data lake.
Dev/ops leader that oversees the implementation and support of GP IT’s Enterprise data lake platform. As a key member of the leadership team this role contributes to the development and execution of the enterprise wide data strategy and is responsible for ensuring the platform and operating environment supporting this strategy are fully aligned, positioning the team to deliver compelling business value in support of data and analytics product teams across the enterprise.
What You Will Do In Your Role
Leadership/Partnership
Build and lead a high-performing data engineering team. Inspire and deliver data engineering innovations that fuel the growth of business; coach team members and grow the skill sets.; Mentor and guide team members as needed
Work with stakeholders to gather, understand, document and prioritize data sourcing requirements ensuring that the agile product team backlogs are refined and well understood by the teams; Ability to influence across different groups and levels in the organization
Provide technical leadership in data engineering practices. Partner with architecture, security, data delivery teams, data scientists and business leaders to establish a strong relationship and trust for prioritizing and delivering data products on time and with a high degree of quality
Management
Managing cross dependencies across teams to ensure alignment, as well as adjusting team directions when gaps exist
Accountable for the design, build and run of the data sourcing strategy to support downstream consumptionacross consumption methods (traditional BI and advanced analytics)
Participate in product release and roadmap planning activities
Manage production data pipelines and ensure SLAs are aligned to business needs
Manage Infrastructure Capacity and resource allocation to optimize spend
Participate in solution testing with stakeholders and development teams to ensure the integration solutions are working as expected and meeting all business objectives
Prioritize projects across the team and allocate resources to meet business and team goals
Architecture
Partner with architecture to establish patterns for re-use, standards, and best practices for DataOps such that problem resolution has minimum latency and incidents are at a minimum
Process the data into clean, accessible sets in alignment with enterprise taxonomy standards
Establish structured sandbox environment (e.g., test and learn zone) to support experimentation where appropriate
Technical
Interface with other technology teams to ingest, process, and store data from a wide variety of data sources using AWS data technologies
Creation and support of real-time data pipelines & querying capability leveraging enterprise standard technologies (e.g., Kafka/Kinesis/SQS, Glue, Spark, Redshift/Spectrum and Athena)
Data Management
Partner with the enterprise data governance tools teams and federated data management teams to establish data dictionary and authoritative sources for the core data elements required to support Business processes and reporting
Recommend technological solutions to improve data quality and data integration across the enterprise data platform
Implement the appropriate governance structure to prescribe data handling, protection, and user provisioning controls
Partner with enterprise data governance tools to support operational activities related to data management such as metadata capture, data quality, data security, data lineage, data inventory; Integrate data and metadata with enterprise tool
The Experience You Will Bring
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree with 10+ years management experience in building and leading data engineering teams
5+ years of industry experience in building & delivering highly performing data engineering solutions: Ingestion, Curation, Modeling, Persistence, Computation and Delivery
Proven Track record of guiding teams through unstructured technical problems to deliver business impact. Demonstrated Ability to translate high-level business objectives into actions.Must be able to reference specific work product in relation to these skills.
5 years experience at running cross-functional relationships and communicating with leadership across multiple organizations
3 – 5 years experience in delivering data solutions and architecture using AWS services like SQS, Kinesis, S3, EMR, Spark, Athena, Redshift, Sagemaker, IOT Core etc.
Demonstrated understanding of Data Architecture, Data Integration, Data Quality, Data Governance and Data Lineage concepts.Must be able to reference specific work product in relation to these skills
5 years experience in building data governance and security in data lake, implementing and supporting data catalog solutions.
Demonstrated communication skills to collaborate with multiple Engineering, IT & business teams.Must have worked in a matrixed environment and provide examples of communication strategy leveraged
5 plus years experience working in Agile environments supporting multiple product owners with competing priorities.
What Will Put You Ahead
Product management experience in Data Management areas (e.g. Data Governance/Data Quality/Data Integration, ETL, Big Data, Streaming Data) and/or equivalent experience as a Product Manager, Technical Lead, Enterprise Architect, Solutions Architect, and has handled multiple data from varied sources (raw, transactional, real-time, streaming, etc.)
Extensive work in Enterprise data projects (ingestion, pipeline, integration, etc.)
Experience working with a variety of database technologies.(e.g. relational, non-relational, timeseries, multi-dimensional…NoSQL, Postgres, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redshift, etc)
Experience in working with both commercial and manufacturing operations data sources.

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.

Position Location: Atlanta, GA
This Senior Data Engineer will play a vital role collaborating as part of this cross-functional Agile team to create and enhance data ingestion pipelines and address big data challenges. The Senior Data Engineer will work closely with the Enterprise Architect, systems engineers, software engineers, and data scientists on the following key tasks:
Provide Extraction, Transformation, and Load (ETL) experience coupled with enterprise search capabilities to solve Big Data challenges
Design and implement high-volume data ingestion and streaming pipelines using Open Source frameworks like Apache Spark, Flink, Nifi, and Kafka on AWS Cloud
Leverage strategic and analytical skills to understand and solve customer and business centric questions
Create prototypes and proofs of concept for iterative development
Learn new technologies and apply the knowledge in production systems
Monitor and troubleshoot performance issues on the enterprise data pipelines and the data lake
Partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition, transformation, processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives
Qualifications
Requires BA/BS degree in related field or technical institute training and 5 or more years related experience; multi platform experience; expert level experience with business and technical applications, or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. Incumbent should also have the ability to mentor others, lead multiple small projects and provide troubleshooting support. Multi dimensional required. Multi database and/or multi language preferred.
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, NiFi.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python (preferred) and/or Java.
Experience with Snowflake to build the Data lake layers
Experience with and managing data across relational SQL and NoSQL databases like MySQL, Postgres, Cassandra, HDFS, Redis, and Elasticsearch.
Experience working in a Linux environment.
Experience working with and designing REST APIs.
Experience in designing/developing platform components like caching, messaging, event processing, automation, transformation and tooling frameworks.
Experience developing data ingest workflows with stream-processing systems: Spark-Streaming, Kafka Streams and/or Flink.
Experience transforming data in various formats, including JSON, XML, CSV, and zipped files.
Experience with performance tuning of ETL jobs.
Experience developing flexible ontologies to fit data from multiple sources and implementing the ontology in the form of database mappings / schemas.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills necessary to work effectively with customers and other team members.
Preferred Qualifications / Experience:
Data engineering experience in the Intelligence Community or other government agencies.
Experience with Microservices architecture components, including Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience developing microservices to fit data cleansing, transformation and enrichment needs.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift, Athena and/or Glue.
Experience with Jira, Confluence and extensive experience with Agile methodologies.
Knowledge about security and best practices.
Experience developing flexible data ingest and enrichment pipelines, to easily accommodate new and existing data sources.
Experience with software configuration management tools such as Git/Gitlab, Bamboo, Salt, Confluence, etc.
Experience with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and their enabling tools such as Jenkins, Nexus, etc.
Detailed oriented/self-motivated with the ability to learn and deploy new technology quickly.

Company Description
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.
In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.
In 2019, Eurofins generatedtotal revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Job Description
Review and interpret diagnostic and genetics patient test results prepared by technologists; prepare and/or review laboratory report for each result
Provide technical supervision of lab procedures, including monitoring of appropriate test indication, related test procedures and troubleshooting.
Assure accurate, reliable and prompt reporting of test results
Monitor and evaluate key indicators of the quality of the analytical testing process (pre-analytical, analytical and post-analytical) for each testing method employed in the lab to ensure the accuracy, reliability and integrity of patient test results and reports:
Monitor quality control procedures
Take action to correct problems and /or errors; document remedial action.
Ensure compliance with CLIA (Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments), OSHA (Occupational Safety and Hazards Act), and CAP (College of American Pathologists)
Previous laboratory experience in the following: Quality Control data review/principles, generating quality metrics, proficiency testing or other data review
Knowledge of clinical laboratory regulatory standards/requirements and inspection experience. i.e. CAP, CLIA, MA, NY or other such as FDA.
Previous experience in laboratory process auditing
Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
PhD or MS degree in medical laboratory science or another scientific discipline
Previous experience with electronic document control within a laboratory setting
Expertise in genetic testing methods and techniques as appropriate for laboratory
Previous PCR experience in a clinical setting or with human sampling
Minimum two (2) years of experience in a clinical genetics laboratory required, completion of training in ABMGG accredited program OR current license to practice medicine in GA
Certification is required by the American Board of Medical Genetics and Genomics, American Board of Pathology, or other appropriate medical board
Additional Information
Position is Full Time, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd shifts available
Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Tucker, GA are encouraged to apply.
Excellent full time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options
Life and disability insurance
401(k) with company match
Paid vacation and holidays
Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

40 Water St, Boston, MA 02109, USA

Company Description
Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that’s built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID®, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon’s award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world’s top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg.
Job Description
The Analytic Consulting Group partners with internal and external clients and data providers leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought process and effective decision making. As the Director of Analytics, you’ll be hands-on and manage analytic initiatives from conception to completion, providing clients and key stakeholders actionable results and insights that help them achieve their business objectives.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the client’s business situation and develop data driven insights that can be understood and implemented to drive marketing strategies
Develop project requirements, analytic plans, Statement of Work (SOWs), project timelines, data pulls, analyses, reports and other related materials for the management of deliverables
Conduct analysis by qualitatively and/or quantitatively analyzing data/information, prepare reports and analyses, uncovering insights and developing business recommendations based on data findings
QA/QC data and report or analyses output to ensure accuracy
Create compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations
Present analyses/ reports to key internal and external stakeholders, effectively communicating the key findings and recommendations
Serve as the primary point of contact for all phases of the analytic projects, from problem definition to presentation of results to prioritizing and monitoring project progress against goals while tracking budgeted hours
Manage multiple projects concurrently to ensure successful completion of analytic projects
Support sales process by assessing prospective clients’ needs and crafting/ presenting proposals that meet those needs
Explore and capitalize on opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell existing clients
Communicate and engage with key internal business partners and Epsilon clients to devise strategic direction and to collaboratively solve business problems
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline
A minimum of 8 years professional hands-on experience with statistical modeling, data mining and advanced analytic techniques using large marketing databases
A minimum of 5 years proven managerial or supervisory experience
Proven experience managing and delivering a wide variety of analytic solutions to internal and external stakeholders
Experience with marketing measurement process, frameworks, tools, campaigns and statistical algorithms
Working knowledge of databases such as Hadoop or Netezza and cloud-based systems such as AWS
Possess exceptional technical skills with hands-on working competencies with advanced SQL and R/ Python for large scale databases
Ability to articulate and deliver insights and recommendations to the client and executive audience
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; including PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Outlook
Ability to display data visually creating powerful presentations which effectively demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables
Sound experience influencing a business or marketing strategy through the application and/or management of advanced statistical techniques and data driven solutions
Acute attention to detail (QA/QC)
Desirable Qualifications:
Advanced degree (Master’s or more) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline. MBA preferred
10+ years of experience in marketing analytics field, with strong understanding of quantification of consumer behavior, marketing measurement process, tools and statistical algorithms (e.g. lifetime value, customer segmentation, control groups, A/B testing, multi-variate testing, time-series, media mix modeling, paid media optimization, predictive analytics, supervised/ unsupervised learning)
Experience in web analytics; digital analytics preferred
Solid planning, priority setting, and project management skills with experience managing multiple projects and resources concurrently
Possesses excellent verbal and written communication skills helping to cultivate relationships across diverse teams (including statistical, technical, and marketing resources)
Hands-on programming experience in advanced SQL, R, Python or related language (SAS, PySpark, knowledge of statistical packages for statistical modelling, parsing large quantity of data, AWS)
Visualization experience in Tableau preferred
Some travel to client sites may be required (10-15%) as travel opens up

Additional Information
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

Job Description:
Job Title

Technology Analyst Program - Cyber, Infrastructure, Data Science, IT Project Management - Alpharetta / Marietta

Job Purpose

Technology Analyst Program - Cyber, Infrastructure, Data Science, IT Project Management
-Alpharetta / Marietta


Fiserv's Technology Analyst Program is an early career development program where candidates experience two one-year assignments in a core functional technology role. Each assignment builds upon the other and together will provide a breadth of experience in the business world and unique to you! We are looking for university graduates with drive, passion, and an evolving target for their careers. The best and brightest will be the support system of the firm's future, a pipeline of top talent for positions in vital technology areas across the firm.

The Technology Analyst Program will have opportunities in Cyber, Infrastructure, Data Science, IT Project Management. You will have the opportunity to participate in complicated projects that can have significant outcomes in the business while strengthening the skills fundamental to lead in the FinTech industry. Training curriculum, mentoring, on the job learning, and exposure to senior leadership will be offered in these entry-level opportunities to advance within our company upon completing the two-year program. Fiserv Analyst rotations will have two start dates; January 18, 2021 and June 21, 2021.

Qualifications:
Recent graduates of a bachelor’s degree program
3.0 + GPA
Interest in learning and using emerging technologies
Leading and participating in projects that require advanced data and business analysis skills including best in practice methodologies and modeling.
Forecasting key metrics, as well as designing and maintaining statistical models
Working both independently and in a team to provide strategic and tactical, data based, solutions and recommendations to senior leadership.
Must have sophisticated Excel and PowerPoint knowledge
Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills
Strong resourcefulness; a self-starter with analytical skills, attention to detail, problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities
Military-Affiliated applicants encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship
Tech Tracks:
Cyber
Infrastructure
Data Science
IT Project Management
Majors:

A range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science, Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Cyber Security, MIS, Data Science, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate.

Please Note: Our Technology Analyst Program interview process begins in October and typically lasts through March for a January or June 2021 start date. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications align.

Help clients understand leading business processes so they can transform their business with Oracle

Experienced with Oracle SaaS Cloud Products
Experienced with HCM, ERP, or CX domain data schemas including mapping of old data to new

Experienced in providing recommendations on how data should be cleansed, transformed and loaded

Experienced using Excel Macro and Unix scripting

Experienced in understanding of cloud architecture and ability to participate in discussions around building new solutions and migrating existing data applications to Oracle Cloud

Here’s what you need:
Minimum of 3 years of Consulting or Client Service Delivery experience on Oracle Cloud
Minimum of 5 years of Hands-on experience with Oracle Cloud Applications
Minimum of 5 years of relational database management system (RDBMS) experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or a related discipline or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate Degree, must have minimum of 6 years work experience)
Bonus points if you have:
Complex query build experience
Understanding of full technology stack of services including PaaS (Platform as-a-service), IaaS (Infrastructure as-a-service), SaaS (Software as-a-service), operations, management and automation

Position Description:
POSITION PURPOSE
The Senior Data Analyst will analyze multiple components of a problem and then make conclusions using high-level quantitative skills to help drive subsets of larger projects, initiatives, and individual processes or projects that bring value to The Home Depot. They will be responsible for working collaboratively with other analysts to apply established analytical processes on diverse data sets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. This person should be able to effectively communicate to teams and other leaders, review and understand sales/financial data, and identify trends in business and the retail industry. This position leverages technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. This role will ensure that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are competently completed in a timely manner continually seeking out opportunities to hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics). This role uses strategic thinking to see the big picture, determine the problem and understand fundamental parts of the problem; provide input on strategy based on knowledge of industry and technology trends. You should be able to communicate issues and roadblocks related to their areas of responsibility, as well as facilitate workout problem-solving sessions with multiple groups of people. This role will prepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analyses.
MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
25%- Interpret data based on specific knowledge of statistics and procedures used/ Provide Data to all directors to support decision making. Provide input on forecast based on knowledge of product and technology.
20%- Review sales/financial analyses (what sold/did not sell; determine which categories have potential to move upward; cost/benefit analysis; data process modeling/analysis of problems, regression analysis).
15%- Identify trends in consumer lifestyle and technology; conduct customer focus groups and analyze/synthesize findings. Scan business/industry trends; scan competitive landscape; analyze consumer data.
20%- Provide input on strategy based on knowledge of industry and technology trends. Provide customers with specialized information from a variety of resources. Facilitate workout problem-solving sessions with multiple groups of people.
20%- Synthesize findings and derive conclusions from analyses and make oral/written recommendations to upper management. Execute tasks related to core operations projects and/or process improvements. Execute day to day processes related to their areas of responsibility. Communicate issues and roadblocks related to respective area.
NATURE AND SCOPE
This position reports to a Sr Manager Analytics Services
This position has no direct reports.
ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS
Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time

ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Education Required:
The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

Years of Relevant Work Experience: 4 years
Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Preferred Qualifications:
2-4 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting
Knowledge of data modeling, data validation and extracting insights from data in a Cloud environment is preferred (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) Google Big Query
Strong understanding and application of SQL joining relational tables together and/or some knowledge of one other scripting/compiled/statistical programming language (e.g. Python, R, SAS, .NET, C++, Java, etc.)
Experience building reports/analyses with analytical tools (Tableau, Tableau On-Cloud)
Exposure to Salesforce within mid-to-large size organization; Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Field Service Lightning creating reporting, dashboards and analytics from generated data preferred
Experience working in analytics function
Operational and industrial engineering knowledge focused on complex processes is desired.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problem solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying store being told within the data.
Creative approach to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolution.
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.
Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment. Ability quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Alight unlocks enterprise growth for the world’s most influential companies with future-ready human capital and business solutions. Alight combines industry leading data and insights with unmatched depth and operational expertise to improve the employee experience and optimize cloud-enabled business processes. Alight’s 15,000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of clients and their more than 30 million employees and family members throughout 180 countries. Alight helps organizations of all sizes, including over 70% of the Fortune 100, achieve next level transformation.
The Senior Data Analyst provides technical expertise for support, build and maintenance of electronic data interchange applications through all stages of projects for a portfolio of clients. The Senior Data Analyst will partner with a team of internal and external partners, provide platform implementation and ongoing maintenance services for clients.
Your Impact as a Senior Data Analyst
Partner with internal and external team members to provide expertise for data related to our platforms and benefits administration
Provide management of assigned client import/exports, payroll/carrier files, and discrepancy reports, inclusive of prioritization dependent upon complexity and delivery deadlines for a portfolio including our clients with increased complexity
Provide technical support and responses to inquiries regarding partner feeds, working to pro-actively resolve issues, relaying to the appropriate internal/external person(s)
Routinely conduct analysis of data transactions for assigned clients, assisting team members as necessary
Make recommendations and apply resolutions for data problems while actively solving new and non-routine errors
Develop and execute various test plans to deliver accurate results to internal/external partners
Prepare required documentation and other reports as requested by internal/external partners
Ensure all projects follow corporate security policies
Delegate and mentor Data Analysts assigned to support complex client cases with total ownership of technology as related to the DA responsibilities for the client
Learning new tools and processes
Other ad hoc projects
Knowledge & Skills required
Familiarity with standard concepts, best practices and procedures within benefits administration and management
Excellent communication and time management skills utilized in planning and delivery on new and existing client support, inclusive of multi-tasking and prioritization of project deliverables
2-5 years of relevant job experience, with increasing amounts of responsibility
Ability to partner seamlessly with internal and external team members
Microsoft Excel Proficiency, Access a plus
Ability to work well under pressure, especially during high volume client implementation periods
Ability to listen to feedback and adjust communication style dependent upon the audience
Ability to think critically and develop creative business solutions to meet business needs
Ability to identify and implement process improvements
Familiarity with data technology, specifically EDI
Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
May be required to travel dependent upon client needs. Less than 10%.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, Networking, or Business preferred

Are you ready to spend your summer as a part of something special? Imagine being with a company whose reputation for excellence paves the way for endless success. At Genuine Parts Company (GPC), people build long-lasting, highly satisfying careers and make a real difference in the community.
GPC has been driving success for over 90 years due to a family of 50,000+ dedicated, intelligent, and innovative employees. But this is the best part – all our businesses throughout the world emphasize the growth and development of our team members by providing opportunities for mentorship and advancement.
The role:
This is the ideal role for a student who is searching for challenging and exciting projects, professional growth, and fun networking opportunities with a Fortune 200 company. As a Search Data Analyst Intern at GPC, you’ll have the opportunity to assist in the execution of digital strategy goals via search awareness and e-commerce adjustments while learning about a global distribution organization.
This is the right opportunity for you if you:
Enjoy comparing data from two sources and showing gaps in correlation
Thrive on challenging deadlines and managing competing priorities
Want to learn how a global leader in the distribution of automotive and industrial parts operates day-to-day
A day in the life:
Monitor and administer web analytics reports/dashboards and keyword reporting tools, and point out key areas of improvements that align with business goals
Evaluate search results and performance metrics across all search channels and recognize baselines as they change
Work closely with other digital team members to meet business goals and project deadlines
What’s in it for you:
Participate in biweekly Lunch and Learn events with company leaders
Attend a Braves game and volunteer time with fellow interns
Explore the history of the company through a multi-day orientation, complete with a tour of the Atlanta Distribution Center
Present your summer project to fellow interns and GPC executives
COVID-19 Accommodations at GPC: Your safety is our top priority – although we are planning for an in-person program, we will continually monitor COVID-19 health safety recommendations and adjust all internship activities as needed.
What you’ll need:
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program, seeking degree in Computer Science or related field
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
And if you have this, even better:
Scripting language skills
Experience with Microsoft Office
Analytical skills and attention to detail
Why GPC may just be the right place for you:
Stable Fortune 200 company with a “family” culture
Environment that works hard, yet takes care of employees
Opportunity for accessing multiple career paths
Ongoing training and development, with support from leaders and your team
Additional information for you:
GPC has great careers for people with all backgrounds and interests. So, if after reading this, you don’t think this is the perfect fit for you, check out the list of other opportunities we have at jobs.genpt.com.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Sciences and Advanced Analytics
Job Description:
Search Jobs


Job Description
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.

Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
CloudHealth by VMware is the world's most trusted software platform for accelerating business transformation in the cloud. We provide integrated reporting, recommendations, and active policy management to help companies control the problems associated with "cloud chaos." Our comprehensive platform gives enterprise companies and MSPs the ability to visualize, optimize and govern their cloud and hybrid environments. CloudHealth Technologies partners with many of the largest enterprise cloud consumers in the world, serving more than 10,000 customers, and managing over $11B in cloud spend.
Our recent acquisition by VMware has put us in a unique position to give our customers and partners access to a portfolio of cloud services that deliver a consistent and actionable view into cost and resource management, security, and performance across multiple clouds.
Job Role and Responsibility:
The Business Operations team is responsible for supporting the CloudHealth Revenue team to deliver best-in-class BI, Data, and Analytic services to the business unit. As a team member of Business Operations at CloudHeatlh, you will lead data, business intelligence, and advanced analytics efforts to drive significant business value for the business unit.
In this role, you will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into driving key business decisions. You will also partner with internal customers to analyze data, leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought and effective decision making. The Data Analyst helps support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion.
Perform exploratory data analysis, analytical modeling, model technique identification, and data-driven decision support
Support Revenue Team stakeholders in improving effectiveness and revenue contribution through analytic optimizations and strategic insights
Develop deep knowledge of CloudHealth’s data assets, extract and prepare data for modeling from enterprise databases, using SQL and other tools, deriving and sharing insights from visualizations, correlations and other statistics with the greater analytics team.
Facilitate internal stakeholder engagement discussions on business and data requirements, recommend solutions, and work with team members for solutioning
Work across a variety of business intelligence, advanced analytics, and data sciences projects. Exposure to operations analytics, channel sales, and/or SaaS project management is a plus
Drive strategic ownership and guidance on business intelligence and analytics across all functions including internal stakeholders like Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Product Management teams
Manage all phases of program to success, including initiation, planning, definition, design, development, testing and deployment cycles
Foresee, manage, and raise appropriate visibility to risks and issues; Drive resolution of any conflicts and escalate as needed to avoid roadblocks

Required Skills:
You would have exposure to BI, advanced analytics, and data sciences in a leading firm for at least 5 years.
Technical experience in statistics, predictive modeling, and other data sciences, as well as experience in developing datasets and working with data science professionals to capture and articulate requirements in an agile fashion for project execution
Can you manage senior stakeholders across teams?
Facilitate exposure to math modeling and analytical techniques for predictive analytics, classification, and segmentation desirable.
Good exposure to reporting and data visualization tools like Tableau, Einstein, etc.
Business knowledge of VMware products is added advantage
Good presentation and summarization skills.
As a leader of project and program you should demonstrate structured thought process and problem-solving approach
You should have worked in a global delivery model and enable high impact business and analytics solutions
Ability to identify and analyze problems using sound judgment and determine solutions to effectively resolve issues.
Be a "trusted advisor" in the analytics and reporting space with our stakeholders across functions
Ability and motivation to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment daily, independently, and with minimal supervision
Work with analytics and business teams across geographies
Experience is consulting/business developments in analytics environment is added advantage
Ability to articulate business problems to data driven solutions
Exposure to Project/Program management with skills to handle risk and mitigation plans
Good written communication skills to facilitate effective writing of correspondence with internal and external customers.
Master's degree in business analytics or MBA strongly preferred, not required. Minimum 5+ years of experience working with teams across functions required.
Home Office - Anywhere in the United States

This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

Do you thrive in a dynamic, committed, and professional environment and would you like to be a part of a team that positively effects change? Are you up for a challenge of driving technology forward?
At Fiserv, you'll find team environment that values partnership and flexibility. Our rare combination of expertise and innovative spirit is how we deliver the most comprehensive financial solutions to banks and businesses worldwide. We're helping more businesses move money faster and more easily than ever before.
What does a great Multichannel Marketing Analytics Manager do?
You will provide analytics and insights to help marketers throughout Fiserv build and execute effective marketing programs. You will advise, craft and execute the strategic use of multichannel measurement and analytics to derive meaningful insights about prospect/client experience, associate experience, channel optimization and content and campaign performance for all marketing channels.
You will work closely with partners across the Fiserv enterprise to guide use of marketing analytics tools, and will advise analytics and reporting vendors on the implementation of functional and technical multichannel marketing analytics requirements.
As a Multichannel Marketing Analytics Manager you will:
Provide meaningful overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions
Drive the established strategy for measuring the experience across all marketing channels and activities
Manage the strategy for measuring content and campaign performance across all channels for assigned campaigns
Partner with digital marketing channel owners to support channel optimization efforts
Establish template reporting and tools to enable marketers throughout the enterprise to access and interpret marketing data specific to their business areas
Provide scalable training on marketing analytics tools and techniques
Lead the curation of marketing analytics tools for digital channels
Formulate predictive forecasting models based on results of analytics data
Analyze external and internal customer data using database queries (SQL, Access), spreadsheet (Excel) models, web analytics tools (Adobe / Omniture), statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools
Build visualizations and presentations to effectively communicate insights to various partners at all levels of the enterprise
Basic skills for consideration:
4-year college degree in Marketing, Business, Decision Sciences or related discipline
8+ years of progressive experience in Marketing -OR- advanced degree in Marketing or related discipline and 5+ years of related experience in Marketing
Experience in advanced analytic and statistical techniques related to multivariate and A/B testing, digital revenue attribution, customer segmentation, and marketing efficiency
Excellent analytical skills and a high degree of discernment
Strong organizational, communication and presentation skills
Proven track record to handle concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience building and automating management level reporting
Technical Knowledge:
Web Analytics – Adobe Analytics experience required
MS Office suite – PowerPoint, Excel & Word
Analytics Reporting Tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Preferred Skills, Experience, and Education:
Financial services proven experience preferred.
Experience with analytics reporting associated with other digital channel technologies a plus (e.g. AddThis, TINT, Brightcove, Ion, etc.)
Tag Management systems
Marketing Automation Systems

Job Title: Data Engineer Co'Op - Cloud Pak for Data
Job Description:
Introduction
IBM Cloud Pak® for Data is a fully-integrated data and AI platform that modernizes how businesses collect, organize and analyze data to infuse AI throughout their organizations. Cloud native by design, the platform unifies market-leading services spanning the entire analytics life-cycle. From data management, DataOps, governance, business analytics and automated AI, IBM Cloud Pak for Data helps eliminate the need for costly, and often competing, point solutions while providing the information architecture clients need to implement AI successfully.

Building on the streamlined hybrid-cloud foundation of Red Hat® OpenShift®, IBM Cloud Pak for Data takes advantage of the underlying resource and infrastructure optimization and management. The solution fully supports multi-cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure, Google Cloud, IBM Cloud® and private cloud deployments.

The Data and AI Expert Labs organization is looking for a Co'op Data Engineer / Data Scientists to join the Cloud Pak for Data organization to support deployments of the technology for clients.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Starting date for this position is January 2021. This position has flexible hours (approximately 20) while attending school with full-time hours expected in the summer. The position would start off remotely and be evaluated if returning to the office would occur in summer 2021. Summer work location would be San Jose, CA.

What youll do as a Co'op Data Engineer / Data Scientist in the Expert Labs Cloud Pak for Data organization:
Deploy Cloud Pak for Data for IBM clients across various platforms
Deploy AI and Machine Learning solutions for clients on Cloud Pak for Data
Help define Cloud Pak for Data architectures that operationalize the platform and map relevant client use cases to satisfy key stakeholders and drive business value
Assist client development teams with Cloud Pak for Data environment setups, testing scripts, deployments, and production operational metrics/debugging information
Leverage customer data assets to optimize profitability, grow customer relationships, improve experience and satisfy business need
Ensure consistent data quality, establish data standards and governance, integrate data between on premise and cloud both operationally and analytically
Optimize data retrieval and develop dashboards, reports and other visualizations for
stakeholders
Communicate with internal and external clients to understand business needs and deploy successful analytical solutions
Work in an agile, collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists, engineers, and database administrators of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of predicting behaviors
Who You Are:
You have strong technical and analytical abilities, a knack for driving impact and growth, and some experience with containerization, programming/scripting
You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, and designing & implementing solutions to complex technical issues
You thrive on teamwork and have excellent verbal and written communication skills
You have an interest in, understanding of, or experience with Design Thinking and Agile Development methodologies.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Basic knowledge with statistical programming in a language (ex: R, SAS or Java)
Basic understanding of hybrid cloud architectures and data integration needs
Foundational OpenShift, dockers, containers knowledge
Client facing, communications and collaboration skills
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Basic knowledge of statistical concepts such as regressions, time series, mixed model, Bayesian methods, clustering, etc., to analyze data and provide insights
Basic understanding of public and private clouds architecture
Understanding of data usage, process analysis and improvement, technology development/support
Basic knowledge writing database SQL queries (Oracle, PostgresQL, Hive, etc).
Basic knowledge implementing operational best practices such as monitoring, alerting, metadata management
Basic knowledge in open source Machine, and Deep Learning frameworks, model validation and deployment tools, data pipeline technologies, and visualization and data storytelling tools
Basic experience Hortonworks/Cloudera Hadoop, and Spark
Basic experience using RESTful APIs
About Business Unit
IBMs Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBMs Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environmentswith complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when youre looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities where you can truly discover your passion? About IBM
IBMs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

IBM intends this job to be performed entirely outside of Colorado.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

The Company:
ACTS is an award-winning Cloud Solution Provider delivering tailored solutions to clients to drive business outcomes, competitive advantage, and market share for nearly 20 years. We empower enterprises to build cloud-first migration strategies while leading tactical execution with governance every step of the way. Our goal is to meet our customers where they are, guide their strategy, and accelerate their cloud adoption throughout their journey spanning all three Microsoft clouds. As a leading Microsoft Cloud Solutions provider and Microsoft Gold Partner, ACTS was recently awarded as the 2019 Microsoft US Partner Award for Intelligent Cloud - Azure Influencer, and finalist for the Microsoft Global Open Source Data & AI Partner Award in 2018.
We believe technology can reshape our clients’ businesses. We offer every client a unique perspective on technology, so they can recognize new business opportunities and make the most of them. Our most strategic technology partner - Microsoft plays a pivotal role in our delivery of industry-disrupting, technology-driven solutions to clients.
Scope of the Job:
As part of the ACTS Marketing team, this role serves to optimize and improve technology integration, marketing processes, and data alignment across sales and marketing.
This specialist will be responsible for analyzing data using tools like Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and Dynamics 365, Marketing Automation tools like HubSpot, and Web Analytics tools like Google Analytics to track marketing performance and recognize opportunities for improvement.
In addition, this role will support scaled marketing and sales capabilities, leveraging cutting-edge technology, and innovating practices to deliver demand generation across ACTS’ sales and marketing technology stack.
Fundamental Duties:
Make complex marketing technology initiatives real, end-to-end, driving from conception to execution to support ACTS demand generation strategy.
Build, test, and launch new (or manage existing) marketing technology architecture and capabilities based on industry best practices and ensuring adherence to General Data Protection Regulation and email laws such as CASL/CAN-SPAM.
Support the daily operations for ACTS marketing automation platform, including administration, training, testing, troubleshooting, and support.
Document key Marketing Automation Platform tech stack processes and procedures as they develop and evolve.
Collaborate with ACTS architect, developers, and other partners on tool development, such as data integration and API delivery.
Stay up to date on trends and technology in the technical marketing landscape.
Analyze, track, and report on key metrics, improving performance throughout the sales & marketing funnel.
Partner cross-functionally to design and implement campaign tests and apply results.
Execute email campaigns in HubSpot Marketing Automation system including building multi-touch campaigns, logic streams, automation rules, creation of segments, forms and landing pages, email content creation, and deployment.
Interpret and implement digital best practices for email, personalization, segmentation, and data-capture from forms and landing pages.
Cross functionality analysis of sales and marketing databases to evaluate and manage data integrity, maximizing ability to market to contacts.
Build reporting to track retention, identify new customer targets, and pinpoint opportunities to increase sales to current customers.
Responsible for data extractions and lead generation list across DiscoverOrg, HubSpot, Purchased Lists, etc., monitoring data quality across marketing technology stack.
Work with ACTS data scientist to ensures the database is updated and maintained in a timely fashion.
Ability to consider and apply creative problem-solving skills

Minimum Qualifications Required:
BS/BA in computer science, marketing, or business (or related work experience)
Experience working in a marketing automation function, email marketing experience required, preferably in a high-volume environment.
Experience with an enterprise CRM/Marketing Automation platform required, HubSpot and Dynamics 365 Marketing specifically a plus.
Experience with contact attribution, company firmographic applications, and 3rd party integrations with Marketing Automations Tools, HubSpot, and Dynamics 365 a plus.
Experience measuring impact and value of campaigns and touches, using best-practice analytics and testing protocols.
Experience with DAX (Data manipulation in Microsoft Excel/Power BI)
Experience with lead generation and multi-touch nurture streams preferred.
Experience in enterprise web analytics preferred.
Experience with cascading style sheets (CSS)/HTML customization within HubSpot and WordPress a plus
ACTS is headquartered is in Jacksonville, FL. We will consider remote/global candidates; however, the candidate will be required to work US Eastern Standard Time hours.
We offer an excellent benefits program, which includes health, vision, and dental insurance with some costs covered by ACTS. We also provide life insurance and short-term disability insurance for each employee, a 401(k) plan, paid holidays, and accrued paid time off. ACTS provides equal employment and advancement opportunity for all individuals without discrimination because of race, creed, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status and takes affirmative action in the implementation of this policy.

Thank you for your interest in a career at Regions. At Regions, we believe associates deserve more than just a job. We believe in offering performance-driven individuals a place where they can build a career --- a place to expect more opportunities. If you are focused on results, dedicated to quality, strength and integrity, and possess the drive to succeed, then we are your employer of choice.

Regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. The information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of Regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of Regions unless required by law. Such information will be stored for a set period of time. You may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into the careers section of the system.

Job Description:


At Regions, the Data Visualization Partner works with business groups to apply visual communication standards to employ various static and interactive data visualization tools and techniques to design, develop, and evaluate interactive visual communication approaches and solutions in support of various analytic purposes throughout the company.

Primary Responsibilities
Evaluates complex business problems and reviews many possible solutions that leverage data science as well as information design and visualization before providing a solution
Partners closely with business leaders and data products team to consult and drive visual communication standards throughout business groups
Engages key stakeholders to enhance visual communications and develop visual solutions to support various analytics
Engages with executive-level stakeholders to understand business strategies and needs related to advanced analytics, and translate requirements into captivating designs and effective, sustainable applications towards using quantitative and analytical techniques to accelerate profitable growth and customer engagement - unlocking value across all functional areas of business
Performs technical and professional work in the preparation and creation of infographics products, reports, dashboards, and advanced static visualizations for risk management and banking consumer products
Determines effective formats for the customer and perform end-to-end conceptualization, development, and design of infographics, reports, dashboards, and advanced static visualizations delineated by customer requirements
Prepares wireframe proof-of-concepts for customers based on initial requirements and in accordance with best practices, media policies, procedures, and branding guides
Create layouts, comps, and HTML/CSS prototypes, to communicate vision design and final design requirements to internal stakeholders and development teams
Plans, organizes, and schedules additional customer engagement sessions to ensure accuracy of requirements
Proposes, leads, and participates in user research, usability validation, and A/B testing
Works closely with other team members including User Experience Architects, Business Owners, Product Managers, Content Strategists, and Development Teams to bring designs to life
Establishes relationships with the information and visualization community for knowledge transfer, talent acquisition and collaboration purposes
Works with data scientists to determine the best approach to communicating an analysis or model, then brings it all the way from design through development to production
Educates team members and business users alike in the effective use and development of visual communication products and interfaces and supports the advancement of visual analytics literacy throughout Regions
Creates documentation and delivers training to business users on standards, best practices, and practical approaches to effective visual communication of data and information
Establishes subject matter expertise and strongly influences Regions’ data visualization strategy and enterprise tool selections
Maintains technical skills and knowledge, including interactive reporting and storytelling, multi-modal information design, and narrative visualization
Provides leadership to third-party contractors
Offers advice and guidance to team, assisting in the development of necessary skills and the promotion of continuous improvement initiatives
This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

This is a single incumbent position.

Requirements
Master’s degree and six (6) years of experience in graphic design, information design, media communication, human-computer interaction, or related field
Or Bachelor’s degree and eight (8) years of experience in graphic design, information design, media communications, human-computer interaction, or related field
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in graphic design, in information visualization design and information visualization principles and techniques, modern typography, text formatting, basis cartographic, electronic data gathering and English usage, spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite/Cloud or related (e.g. Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, etc.) as well as Adobe XD and Figma
Experience in producing, developing, and presenting infographic products and advanced static visualizations for business intelligence products, including ability to analyze requests accurately and take effective action
Experience with user research relating to usability heuristics, UX methodologies, usability validation, and A/B testing, as well as applying usability research and UX design techniques to the development of customer-centered visual data products
Experience with and utilization of design-thinking methodologies
Proven portfolio of examples of relevant, finished digital work and their professional application (portfolios consisting of primarily advertising/student work will not be considered)
Supervisory/management experience
Preferences
Background in banking and/or other financial services
Experience in Agile Software Development
Familiarity with Visualization and/or BI tools (Tableau, Looker, QuickSight, Power BI, D3) with proficiency in at least one
Skills and Competencies
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation
Position Type

Full time
Location Details
Regions Center - Birmingham
Location:
Birmingham, Alabama

Overview:
Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:
Our consultants on the Advanced Analytics & Intelligent Automation team help clients maximize the value of their data and automate business processes. This high performing team works with clients to implement the full spectrum of data analytics and data science, from data querying and data wrangling, to data visualization and dashboarding, to predictive analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence as well as robotic process automation (RPA). Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness.
Our consultants focus on client services, while also supporting business development, internal firm initiatives, and ongoing professional development.

Qualifications:
Security clearance: Ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance

Minimum years of relevant experience: 3

Education: B.S./B.A. in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics, Data Science, Data Analytics, or similar quantitative discipline.
Experience working with analytical models, methods, applications, and tools, such as:
Statistical analysis, predictive modelling, simulation, machine learning, and artificial intelligence
Selecting and applying the appropriate analytical techniques
Analytics for business, operations, human capital, or financial management
Analyzing large and complex data sets, with strong aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis
Proficiency in an analytics programming language, such as R, Python, or SAS
Visualization skills with tools such Tableau, Power BI, or R Shiny
Desired Experience:
Education: M.S./M.A. in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics, Data Science, Data Analytics, or similar quantitative discipline.

Skills and/or proven success in the following:
Contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles, contributing to a positive working environment by building strong, collaborative relationships with team members
Collaborating and working in a team environment, as well as the ability to work independently
Communicating effectively to various audiences, including various levels of management and external clients, in a professional environment
Identifying and addressing client needs, building relationships with clients, demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks, communicating potential conflicts to a supervisor
Business development including RFP/RFQ responses, developing white papers/concept papers, and building and demonstrating prototype solutions to customers
Knowledge of defense, national security, financial, healthcare, international development, or state and local government environment

Overview of Position
The Data Engineer will join the data science and reporting team embedded within the Technology Enabled Services organization. The team member will assist in the creation of data driven solutions to business problems including data consolidation and normalization, generation of actionable business insight, building advanced analytical models, and preparing data for artificial intelligence applications.
What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Engage with team members including data analysts and data scientists to understand the data needs of the solution in development and turn them into logical patterns or requirements
Create and automate ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to populate data storage solutions confirming data integrity
Employ data architecture best practices. Recommends data integrity standards including frameworks and templates, naming conventions, coding standards, and file formats
Work with IT to leverage cloud systems (Azure/AWS/GCP) and tools to enhance business intelligence and facilitate delivery to customers
What are the requirements needed for this position?
At least one year of experience in data science, analytics, or business intelligence
Comfortable working with large, complex data systems for use in business analysis
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Working knowledge of data management software packages, such as Spark, Hadoop, SQL Server, Python
Experience with a visualization solution like Power BI
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to excel in a dynamic work environment with a “self-start” attitude
What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?
General office demands
How much should I expect to travel?
10%

Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Sciences and Advanced Analytics
Job Description:
Search Jobs


Job Description
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.

Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
CloudHealth by VMware is the world's most trusted software platform for accelerating business transformation in the cloud. We provide integrated reporting, recommendations, and active policy management to help companies control the problems associated with "cloud chaos." Our comprehensive platform gives enterprise companies and MSPs the ability to visualize, optimize and govern their cloud and hybrid environments. CloudHealth Technologies partners with many of the largest enterprise cloud consumers in the world, serving more than 10,000 customers, and managing over $11B in cloud spend.
Our recent acquisition by VMware has put us in a unique position to give our customers and partners access to a portfolio of cloud services that deliver a consistent and actionable view into cost and resource management, security, and performance across multiple clouds.
Job Role and Responsibility:
The Business Operations team is responsible for supporting the CloudHealth Revenue team to deliver best-in-class BI, Data, and Analytic services to the business unit. As a team member of Business Operations at CloudHeatlh, you will lead data, business intelligence, and advanced analytics efforts to drive significant business value for the business unit.
In this role, you will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into driving key business decisions. You will also partner with internal customers to analyze data, leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought and effective decision making. The Data Analyst helps support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion.
Perform exploratory data analysis, analytical modeling, model technique identification, and data-driven decision support
Support Revenue Team stakeholders in improving effectiveness and revenue contribution through analytic optimizations and strategic insights
Develop deep knowledge of CloudHealth’s data assets, extract and prepare data for modeling from enterprise databases, using SQL and other tools, deriving and sharing insights from visualizations, correlations and other statistics with the greater analytics team.
Facilitate internal stakeholder engagement discussions on business and data requirements, recommend solutions, and work with team members for solutioning
Work across a variety of business intelligence, advanced analytics, and data sciences projects. Exposure to operations analytics, channel sales, and/or SaaS project management is a plus
Drive strategic ownership and guidance on business intelligence and analytics across all functions including internal stakeholders like Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Product Management teams
Manage all phases of program to success, including initiation, planning, definition, design, development, testing and deployment cycles
Foresee, manage, and raise appropriate visibility to risks and issues; Drive resolution of any conflicts and escalate as needed to avoid roadblocks

Required Skills:
You would have exposure to BI, advanced analytics, and data sciences in a leading firm for at least 5 years.
Technical experience in statistics, predictive modeling, and other data sciences, as well as experience in developing datasets and working with data science professionals to capture and articulate requirements in an agile fashion for project execution
Can you manage senior stakeholders across teams?
Facilitate exposure to math modeling and analytical techniques for predictive analytics, classification, and segmentation desirable.
Good exposure to reporting and data visualization tools like Tableau, Einstein, etc.
Business knowledge of VMware products is added advantage
Good presentation and summarization skills.
As a leader of project and program you should demonstrate structured thought process and problem-solving approach
You should have worked in a global delivery model and enable high impact business and analytics solutions
Ability to identify and analyze problems using sound judgment and determine solutions to effectively resolve issues.
Be a "trusted advisor" in the analytics and reporting space with our stakeholders across functions
Ability and motivation to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment daily, independently, and with minimal supervision
Work with analytics and business teams across geographies
Experience is consulting/business developments in analytics environment is added advantage
Ability to articulate business problems to data driven solutions
Exposure to Project/Program management with skills to handle risk and mitigation plans
Good written communication skills to facilitate effective writing of correspondence with internal and external customers.
Master's degree in business analytics or MBA strongly preferred, not required. Minimum 5+ years of experience working with teams across functions required.
Home Office - Anywhere in the United States

This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.
